docs.snippet: Sam, a defensive end from Missouri, was selected by the St. Louis Rams in the seventh round, becoming the first publicly gay player to be drafted by an N.F.L. team....
docs.lead_paragraph: Sam, a defensive end from Missouri, was selected by the St. Louis Rams in the seventh round, becoming the first publicly gay player to be drafted by an N.F.L. team.
docs.abstract: Michael Sam, defensive end from Missouri, becomes first publicly gay football player to be chosen in the NFL draft after St Louis Rams selects him in the final round; Sam's draft status was seen as barometer of whether the NFL was ready to accept an openly gay player.

headline.main: In Historic Pick, Rams Take Michael Sam in Final Round of Draft
headline.print_headline: Historic Choice in Final Round of N.F.L. Draft

byline.contributor: Zach Schonbrun and Andrew Keh contributed reporting.

docs.snippet: Picking seven players with no history of off-the-field scandals or insubordination, the Giants are hoping for immediate and enduring contributions from their draft selections....
docs.lead_paragraph: Picking seven players with no history of off-the-field scandals or insubordination, the Giants are hoping for immediate and enduring contributions from their draft selections.
docs.abstract: Overarching theme of New York Giants selections in NFL draft was the pursuit of character and citizenship.

headline.main: With ‘Clean’ Picks, Giants Look Beyond Talent
headline.print_headline: With ‘Clean’ Picks, Giants Look Beyond Talent

docs.snippet: Mr. Nunn parlayed his knowledge of football at historically black colleges into a job with the Pittsburgh Steelers and helped them win four Super Bowls from 1975 to 1980....
docs.lead_paragraph: Mr. Nunn parlayed his knowledge of football at historically black colleges into a job with the Pittsburgh Steelers and helped them win four Super Bowls from 1975 to 1980.
docs.abstract: Bill Nunn, scout whose deep knowledge of football programs at historically black colleges helped many overlooked players find their way to the Pittsburgh Steelers, turning team into a powerhouse, dies at age 89.

headline.main: Bill Nunn, Scout Who Shaped Steelers’ Super Bowl Teams, Dies at 89
headline.print_headline: Bill Nunn, 89, Scout Who Helped Make Steelers a Powerhouse
